metadata.title: CVE-2018-14678 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.11, as used in Xenthrough 4.11.x. The xen_failsafe_callback entry point inarch/x86/entry/entry_64.S does not properly maintain RBX, which allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory usage andsystem crash). Within Xen, 64-bit x86 PV Linux guest OS users can trigger aguest OS crash or possibly gain privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
